definitions.text: an implement that has hairs or bristles firmly set into a handle
conducts current between rotating and stationary parts of a generator or motor
a bushy tail or part of a bushy tail (especially of the fox)
the act of brushing your teeth
examples: the dentist recommended two brushes a day

definitions.text: the act of brushing your hair
examples: he gave his hair a quick brush

definitions.text: contact with something dangerous or undesirable
examples: I had a brush with danger on my way to work
he tried to avoid any brushes with the police

definitions.text: rub with a brush, or as if with a brush
examples: Johnson brushed the hairs from his jacket
She brushed the suit before hanging it back into the closet
Her long skirt brushed the floor
A gasp swept cross the audience

definitions.text: remove with or as if with a brush
examples: brush the dust from the jacket
brush the bread with melted butter
